Of these, 3.8 million people were targeted for assistance in the southern, eastern, and northern oblasts bordering the front line. Along with service delivery, and the procurement and distribution of medicines and supplies, cash and voucher assistance has been one of the accepted modalities of providing health assistance by health partners as stated in the HNRP.Since the launch of the HNRP in December 2023, air strikes have intensified in areas nearest the frontline and those bordering the Russian Federation. As of January 2024 the humanitarian crisis in Ukraine has worsened significantly.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: Waves of attacks have had a devastating impact on the health and well-being of civilians, disrupting critical services for hundreds of thousands of people at the peak of winter. The May 2024 offensive in Donetska, Kharkivska, Khersonska, Sumska oblasts, has resulted in further displacement as civilians are fleeing to safety. As partners respond, the need to provide guidance on the use of Cash and Vouchers in health has become acute as a result of the increased vulnerability of the people in need.The Ukrainian Health SystemHumanitarian actors in Ukraine operate in a space where emergency health services are offered in tandem with national health services. These services vary in availability and accessibility depending on local conflict dynamics.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: In Ukraine, citizens are guaranteed a package of health services provided at no charge at the point of delivery according to the constitution. Within the national health system, the Ministry of Health MOH develops and approves quality standardsclinical protocols, while issuing licenses to those engaged in health care service delivery, the production and sale of medicines and equipment. Within the scope of the Law on State Financial Guarantees of Health Care, the National Health Service of Ukraine NHSU purchases packages of services Program of Medical Guarantees. Each facility then contracts for the services they have the capacity to provide, and for which they must meet contract requirements and specifications defined by the NHSU for each specific package of services.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: Currently, the NHSU pays for all services, provided these are recorded in the eHealth system, without imposing any service caps or waiting times, and according to the tariffs and payment methods defined in the Cabinet of Ministers Resolution regarding the PMG for the given year.The main component of the health system reform has been the strengthening of primary health care. Ukrainians can choose a family doctor, pediatrician or general practitioner at any health facility across the country that has a contract with the NHSU. Patients enter into a contract with the chosen doctor by signing a Patient Declaration Form.3 The declaration is an application form that confirms that the patient is being served by the chosen physician and is funded for care as per the PMG at the healthUkraine Situation Report. This contract enables doctors to diagnose, treat, write prescriptions for medicines including those that are included in the Affordable Medicines Program AMP, and refer patients for specialist care. Primary health care providers are reimbursed per capitation, adjusted for age and terrain, for the number of patients registered with them, as well may receive additional financing for meeting specific vaccination and NCD related indicators. For example, in 2022 additional services such as providing mental health care at the PHC level and providing complex rehabilitation services were included in the PMG.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: With regards to the AMP, the program now accepts paper-based prescriptions and allows internally displaced patients to receive medications without obtaining a new prescription or receiving a prescription from a PHC doctor who they do not have a declaration signed with. Recently, the NHSU broadened the AMP to include painkillers for palliative care patients, immunosuppressive drugs and test strips for determining blood glucose levels in type I diabetes.5 In 2024, the AMP will further expand to include additional medicines for the treatment of mental health conditions. To increase access to medicines, mobile pharmacies were launched in rural and frontline communities in Cherkasy, Kharkivska, Mykolaivksa, Kyivska, and Chernihivska regions. In frontline oblasts, health care is impeded by security constraints, transport, and infrastructural challenges.Since the escalation of the war in 2022, the Health Cluster team through the WHO Surveillance System for Attacks on Health Care has verified 1,814 attacks on health care in Ukraine as of June 2024, with 143 deaths and 342 injuries to health care workers and patients.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: Attacks on health care deprive vulnerable populations of urgently needed care, undermine health systems, and endanger long-term public health goals.A recent WHO survey conducted in the frontline areas of Dnipro, Donetska, Kharkivska, Khersonska, Mykolaivska, Odeska, and Zaporizhzhia found that approximately 10 of the population lacked consistent access to primary healthcare services 10 in June 2023, 9 in September 2023. Households with members having chronic conditions and children reported even greater difficulties, with 16 experiencing access issues. The primary challenge for those with chronic conditions was financial barriers to treatment, medication, and diagnostics, affecting 42 of this group. The cost of services increased as a barrier from 29 in June to 37 in September 2023.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: Although the majority of respondents 87 reported having access to pharmacies within a 30-minute walk, 10 faced challenges in obtaining medicines, primarily due to availability issues 41.Ukraine Health Cluster: Health Context and Response Update September 2023 ENUKThe Affordable Medicines Program Is Helping Ukraine Achieve Health Equity Despite the War Affordable Medicines Programme: what are the development priorities for 2024?---The most recent round of data collection in April 2024 results not yet published revealed improvements in access to primary healthcare, with only 6 unable to reach a family doctor. However, 19 of those with chronic conditions still faced access issues, up slightly from 16 in December 2023, with financial constraints remaining the main barrier. Pharmacy access remained stable since December 2023, but access to medicines improved over the last three months, increasing from 16 to 25. Nonetheless, 9 still faced issues, primarily due to price and availability.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: Additionally, 16 of respondents experienced problems obtaining prescribed medicines in April 2024, with cost 26 and availability 19 being the main barriers.Cash and voucher assistance for health in tandem with supply side inputs to the health system through humanitarian health action has the potential to reduce financial barriers and mostly for the vulnerable groups, there is an opportunity to use this modality in addressing health outcomes and reducing costs to accessing health services. Positioning Sectoral Cash and Voucher Assistance in HealthSeveral assessment findings have highlighted an increase in household expenditures on health mostly related to the purchase of medicines since the 2022 escalation of the war. This is evidenced by the 2nd round of the Multi-Sector Needs Analysis MSNA, 2023, the WHO Health Needs Assessment HNA 3, and other surveys repeated to gauge population's perceptions on health and barriers to services, including financial ones.The Ukraine humanitarian response has followed up commitments put forth in the Grand Bargain to prioritize cash assistance where possible. Although assessments highlight beneficiary preferences for cash, there's no guarantee that recipients will use the health portion of Multi-Purpose Cash assistance MPCA to meet health needs.

title: Ukraine Cash and Voucher Health Framework 1.0 MAY 2024
paragraph: MPCA cash is unrestricted and can be used for other household needs and services prioritized by the beneficiary. Furthermore, health needs can be costly, unpredictable, and thus challenging to be met through recurrent MPC payments. Allegations of corruption from both out- of-pocket and informal payments in health only reinforce cash in health as a sensitive topic.To provide guidance and organize the implementation of cash and voucher assistance in health, the Health Cluster is adopting a sector-specific approach to inform the process, taking into account the challenges which exist while capping the volume of emergency HNRP support, which can be implemented using a voucher approach. Sectoral cash and voucher assistance in health shouldn't disrupt regular functioning of the health system but should complement it with a clear phase-out strategy incorporated during the planning process.Ukraine CVA for Health Framework conceptual modelThe Ukraine CVA for Health Framework is informed by the Tanahashi framework, a conceptual model used in public health to assess bottlenecks and improve access to health care services.
